thread.title: Portland brunch spot among Esquire's best new restaurants of 2015
thread.title_full: Portland brunch spot among Esquire's best new restaurants of 2015 | OregonLive.com

author: Michael Russell | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland brunch spot among Esquire's best new restaurants of 2015
text:
Muscadine , the quietly impressive southern brunch spot in Northeast Portland, was named one of Esquire's best new restaurants in America , the magazine announced Tuesday.
The November issue, devoted to the late Portland food writer Josh Ozersky, highlights a new era of collaboration and cooperation between chefs.
Ozersky planned most of the guide, but his unexpected death came "just in time to exhaust the Best New Restaurants travel budget, but not in time, sadly, to write the stories." I would have loved to read what he had to say about Muscadine.
The restaurant, opened by chef Laura Rhoman last November, serves recipes from the Southeastern United States at brunch and lunch. The menu includes historical recipes like the Country Captain, an 18th Century curry with Indian influences still popular in South Carolina, and one of the city's best plates of fried chicken . It's slowly become one of my favorite brunch spots in Portland.
Muscadine is a worthy pick, and the issue is a fitting tribute to Ozersky.
Related: Muscadine offers a taste of the south in Northeast Portland
For years, Esquire's restaurant coverage felt like it had lost step with current food world trends. The magazine effectively ignored the recent Portland restaurant boom, naming just one local restaurant to its list in the past a decade . Ozersky took over Esquire's restaurant coverage last year, the same year he moved to Portland, and though Portland's drought continued in 2014 , he promised it would end soon.
The drought ends soon. All hail the PDX. Portland snubbed by Esquire's Best New Restaurants list again http://t.co/fSuvbKq7uI via @oregonian
— Josh Ozersky (@OzerskyTV) October 15, 2014 Ox, Beast, Le Pigeon, etc. deserved the honor in the past IMO. Portland snubbed by Best New Restaurants again http://t.co/fSuvbKq7uI
— Josh Ozersky (@OzerskyTV) October 15, 2014
The restaurant issue is still being unveiled online, but it already looks like Esquire's best in years.
Visit Muscadine at 1456 N.E. Prescott St., Suite F; 503-841-5576; muscadinepdx.com . Note: Muscadine will be closed through Oct. 21 to attend the Southern Foodways Alliance Symposium in Oxford, Mississippi.
-- Michael Russell Follow @tdmrussell
